pages.title: First, tell us a little about yourself
pages.header: This survey takes approximately 5 minutes to complete.

fields.label: How long have you worked at this organization (in years)?
fields.name: org_years

fields.label: What team and/or department do you work in?
fields.name: team

fields.label: How many layers of management are you below {{orgLeader}}?
fields.help: If you're not sure, take your best guess.
fields.name: management_layers

fields.label: We are growing faster than our competitors.
fields.name: org_traction

fields.label: We are more profitable than our competitors.
fields.name: org_profitability

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

options.peop1: We rarely talk about our financial success (or failure), but instead check ourselves against progress toward our organization’s purpose
options.peop2: I've turned down lucrative offers from other companies because I'm committed to this organization's purpose
options.peop3: I am surrounded by amazing talent – partners and colleagues – and we’re all here to pursue our organization’s purpose
options.peop4: I know exactly how my goals or objectives connect to our organization’s purpose
options.peop5: In the absence of a clear directive, I use our organization’s purpose to make tough decisions and do the right thing

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: peop_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

options.eeoc1: When it comes to my success, my customers’ satisfaction is more important than my superiors’ opinions
options.eeoc2: I have a budget, and I’m free to spend it the way I see fit
options.eeoc3: I have the power to abandon work I know isn't generating any value
options.eeoc4: I’m able to deviate from the conventions that govern my work, including the software, hardware, tools and practices I use to get it done
options.eeoc5: When it's not clear who has the authority to make a decision, I feel safe asking for forgiveness later

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: eeoc_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

options.eeop1: We rarely have a “big reveal” – instead we make many small changes
options.eeop2: I've been part of a team working on an experimental, unproven product with no clear roadmap
options.eeop3: I am allowed to make changes to my team's basic structure (size, people, roles) with their consent
options.eeop4: It is easy to release or ship products and services to customers
options.eeop5: We use cloud-based, real-time collaborative software instead of passing around e-mail attachments

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: eeop_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

options.neoh1: I have frequent contact with my customers
options.neoh2: When more people use our products, they improve
options.neoh3: The people that review my performance are the ones that work closely with me
options.neoh4: Our products have real-time feedback mechanisms built-in
options.neoh5: I can easily ask people outside my team (even customers) for feedback on work when it's at an early stage

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: neoh_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

options.aeoe1: I am allowed to assume new responsibilities (even if they overlap with someone else), if it brings us closer to realizing our goal
options.aeoe2: My role is creative and I produce output directly, rather than rely on outside vendors
options.aeoe3: I’m rarely asked for projections – instead, I show results from customer-facing tests
options.aeoe4: I can be honest about my failures; I don’t need to put on “success theater”
options.aeoe5: We post or track our failures in a central location

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: aeoe_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

options.teop1: I keep a task list and it’s open to anyone who wants to see it
options.teop2: Our workspace and working styles “default to open” – we use privacy as a tool, only when necessary
options.teop3: I can easily access the information I need to get my work done
options.teop4: Other teams in the organization know exactly how to work with our team, and what they’ll get out of an interaction
options.teop5: I share my work in progress before it’s been packaged for wide consumption

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: teop_verbatims
